result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca L. VanHefty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rebecca L. VanHefty is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rebecca L. VanHefty was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Rebecca L. VanHefty was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample on 10-13-2015.
Pay surcharge from bond.

No contact whatsoever with co-defendant, J.B.
No illegal drugs or prescription drugs, except those prescribed by a doctor and according to doctor's orders.
Undergo assessments and counseling as recommended by agent.
Full time job or community serve - 40 hours a week.

timeConds.notes: Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations for work and childcare, to the extent permitted.

Defendant Rebecca L. VanHefty in court with attorney Michael Gerald Perry.  Allen R Brey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
4:01pm
Atty Perry spks on PSI corrections
ADA spks on sentencing
Atty Perry spks on sentencing
Def's father spks
Def addresses the court
Court imposes: 
Ct 1: Imposed and stayed: 18 months initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision. Not eligible for CIP and SAP.
Ct 2: Imposed and stayed: 18 months initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision. Not eligible for CIP and SAP. Concurrent to ct 1.
2 years probation with conditions:
60 days jail with huber release- for work and for child care- to the extent permitted. 11 days credit. Report to jail by 7pm on 10-20-15
Pay costs, fees and Dna surcharge-to be taken from bond on deposit, remainder to be returned to poster
Undergo assessments and counseling as recommended by agent.
No contact whatsoever with co-def J.B
No illegal drugs or prescription drugs, except those prescribed by a doctor and according to doctor's orders
Full-time job or community service- 40 hours a week
Def must submit Dna sample on 10-13-15
 May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Appeal rights
